data.question: A man with blood group AB marries a woman with blood group O. The possible blood groups of their children will be:
Which of the following represents a monohybrid cross?
The F2 generation obtained from a dihybrid cross shows a phenotypic ratio of:
The term ‘evolution’ means:
data.op_2: Changes in the characteristics of species over generations
data.ans: Changes in the characteristics of species over generations

data.question: Which of the following evidences strongly supports organic evolution?
The human forelimb and the wing of a bird are examples of:
The appearance of new species due to geographical isolation is called:
Evolution of eyes in different organisms such as octopus, insects and vertebrates is an example of:
Industrial melanism observed in peppered moths is an example of:
The vestigial organ ‘appendix’ in human beings is of no use but in herbivorous animals it helps in:
The presence of fossils in sedimentary rocks provides evidence for:
The similarity in embryonic development of fish, birds and humans shows:
Which one of the following is an example of artificial selection?
The theory of natural selection states that:
data.op_1: Only useful variations are passed on to the next generation
data.op_2: All variations are passed on to the next generation
data.ans: Only useful variations are passed on to the next generation
